column4: Still can't get my seperate ubuntu drive to show up, right after boot it just sits at a blinking cursor.
what video chip do you use?
Pretty certain I've done the grub install right, is it a major problem if a windows partition preceeds the grub drive?
Oh sorry, meant that grub doesn't initialize.
if you hold shift at boot do you see grub?
Nope.
It's as if it finds nothing when it tries to boot from ANY drive.
then boot to liveCD and reinstate grub
I've done that now, tried different settings in which partition to flag for boot etc,
the boot flag is irrelevant
grub config is loaded and uses the config there, only windows uses boot flags
I have windows7 on sda, sdc1 is windows (non-boot), sdc2 is ubuntu (with grub) and sdc3 is swap,
I have installed grub onto sdc2, pointed it to boot from sdc
is the drive which is sdc set as boot drive in BIOS?
Yup. I even tried booting every different drive, all are the same with the empty blinking cursor.
if you start liveCD booting then select to boot the internal drive, does it boot ok?
ok, what is the video chip you use?
Nope, it flashes for just a second but just goes away.
ati
tried chrooting and adding boot options to use safe vga etc? May stop the blinking cursor bit
I can get into ubuntu on the flash drive no problem, full resolution and working fine, just wont boot.
It's more just a blank stop, it won't think or read the drive or anything
